Package b2bpl.translation

Contains classes immediately related to the translation of bytecode classes to BoogiePL.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
TranslationConstants  
TranslationContext Helper class which triggers the translation of different kinds of references encountered during the translation to BoogiePL.
 

Class Summary
CodeGenerator Simple utility class providing convenience methods to generate BoogiePL code for frequently used expressions.
MethodTranslator The main entry point to the translation of a bytecode method to a BoogiePL procedure.
ModifiesFilter A translator for BML store references.
SpecificationTranslator A translator for BML specifications.
Translator The main entry point to the translation of a set of bytecode classes to a BoogiePL program.
 

Package b2bpl.translation Description

Contains classes immediately related to the translation of bytecode classes to BoogiePL.

The main entry point to the translation is the Translator class which accepts a set of bytecode classes and translates them to a single BoogiePL program. The actual translation process is thereby split over different classes to which the Translator delegates part of the translation. In particular, the following classes actively contribute to the resulting BoogiePL program during the translation process:

  • The already introduced Translator class is responsible for generating the global theory of the BoogiePL program. This mainly includes the static part of the background predicate such as the axiomatizations of the heap and the JVM's type system but also the dynamic global declarations which are generated in response to special references (type/field/literal... references) encountered during every individual translation session.
  • The MethodTranslator class is responsible for translating a bytecode method to a single procedure in BoogiePL. The translation of a method not only includes the translation of the individual bytecode instructions but also the generation of proof obligations and assumptions as required or justified, respectively, by the verification methodology used.
  • The SpecificationTranslator class is used to translate BML specification expressions to BoogiePL. Specialized factory methods are provided for creating instances of the class suitable for translating specification expressions appearing in different contexts, such as inside an invariant declaration or inside a method's postcondition.
  • The ModifiesFilter class is used to translate BML store references appearing inside the modifies clause of a method or a loop specification.
Since some special references such as field or type references appearing in bytecode instructions or BML specifications cannot be resolved locally but instead require a set of global declarations to be created in the BoogiePL program, the special interface TranslationContext is defined which should always be used to translate those references. The main purpose of having such a separate interface is to decouple the individual classes contributing to the translation process from each other. In the current implementation, the TranslationContext interface is internally implemented by the Translator while every other translator class accepts such an interface which is then used to trigger the translation of the encountered references.
